text:
<@U01B75VG3GR> It currently ‘works’, but as a demonstration it’s useless; we’ll see later how much things improve. I just used iPhone stopwatch to see how long it takes for my notebook to display a histogram of a small dataframe: 21 minutes.
About one minute was spent for the first sign of Pluto loading. About 16 minutes were spent in adding and using some packages.

elements.text:
It currently ‘works’, but as a demonstration it’s useless; we’ll see later how much things improve. I just used iPhone stopwatch to see how long it takes for my notebook to display a histogram of a small dataframe: 21 minutes.
About one minute was spent for the first sign of Pluto loading. About 16 minutes were spent in adding and using some packages.

text: Running this on my MBP with pre-installed packages took 2:40 from command line invocation, Julia 1.5. I’ll try 1.6 soonish.

elements.text: Running this on my MBP with pre-installed packages took 2:40 from command line invocation, Julia 1.5. I’ll try 1.6 soonish.

text:
it can be much faster if you only call Pkg.add once:
```begin
import Pkg
Pkg.add([
"Plots",
"JuMP",
...
])
using Plots, JuMP, ...
end```

elements.text: it can be much faster if you only call Pkg.add once:

begin
import Pkg
Pkg.add([
"Plots",
"JuMP",
...
])
using Plots, JuMP, ...
end
